frontmatter.title: Varieties of constructive mathematics
Lesser Limited Principle of Omniscience
frontmatter.meta: Defined in Varieties of constructive mathematics

mainmatter.p: The lesser limited principle of omniscience (LLPO for short) states that for any binary sequence \{ a_n \} _{n \in \mathbb{N} } that contains at most one 1, either \forall n \in \mathbb{N} . \ a_{2n} = 0 or \forall n \in \mathbb{N} . \ a_{2n + 1} = 0.

The limited principle of omniscience (often abbreviated as LPO) says that, for any binary sequence \{ a_n \} _{n \in \mathbb{N} }, either there exists some n \in \mathbb{N} such that a_n = 1 or a_n = 0 for all n \in \mathbb{N}.
From page 3 of Varieties of Constructive Mathematics.
